isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING PROTECTION AND DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM (APAds™) DESCRIPTION, OPERATION, TROUBLESHOOTING, REMOVE, INSTALL, AND ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MAINTENANCE MANUAL - INSTALL - WIRE HARNESS

svcproc.title: WIRE HARNESS
svcproc.para: The wire harness install procedures are in the following steps.

step1.para: Locate the air conditioning compressor and connect the green wire from the APADS control module to the wire connected to the air conditioning compressor clutch.

note.para: The wire harness has bare leads on one end. It will be necessary to cut these wires based on the required length needed for installation.
The quick disconnect spade connectors have an integral, heat shrinkable seal. After crimping the connectors, use a heat gun to shrink the seal.

step1.para: Connect the blue wire from the APADS control module to the wire connected to the air conditioning compressor clutch.
Connect the power source wire from the air conditioning compressor. This connector should be located about eight inches from the compressor.
Connect the black wire to the ground wire in the power distribution box or the ground post on the alternator.
Connect the red wire to the power wire to the 12 volt keyed ignition source at the power distribution box.
Connect the six pin connector on the wire harness to the APADS control module. If harness is not long enough, use the extension harness.

note.para: Do not strain the wires in the harness. Use the extensions to provide strain relief.

step1.para: Connect the low pressure switch wire harness connector to the A/C low pressure switch.
Connect the high pressure switch wire harness connector to the A/C high pressure switch. Connectors are arranged so that the connection can only be made the correct way.
Locate and connect the four pin connector on the pressure switch wire harness to the four pin connector on the APADS control module.If harness is not long enough, use the extension harness.
Secure the wire harness using the tie wraps and conduit, protect the wires with conduit as necessary. Fasten the six pin wire harness to the vehicle.

step2.para: Fasten wraps about every eight to ten inches.
Do not put too much stress on the harness when installing the tie wraps.
The wire should be fastened tightly but not so tight as to put stress on the harness.
Leave adequate strain relief for each component, including connectors.

step1.para: Turn vehicle ignition to the ON position.
